result.execSummary:
The defendant Aisha Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Fail/Prevent Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(4)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharges.  To be paid from 25% of prison funds.  Balance paid during Extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges waived due to inability to pay.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No physical discipline of any child.
No contact with A.H. unless approved by Children's Court and upon mutual desire.
No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons.

Cognitive Thinking Classes.
Parenting classes, already completed.
Cooperate with CHIPS/BMCW programs.
AODA assessment. Comply with recomended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
Waived, DNA sample, previously ordered.
Court advised due to DV conviction under Federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aisha Jackson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (43 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 07-20-2015 received and filed.

Defendant Aisha Jackson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Aisha Jackson in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, Certificate.
AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, concurrent, credit for 138 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR & 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS & 6 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Cognitive Thinking Classes.
-Parenting classes (already completed).
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Cooperate with CHIPS/BMCW programs.
-No physical discipline of any child.
-No contact with A.H., unless approved by children's' court and upon mutual desire.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms/dangerous weapons.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-WAIVED, DNA Sample -previously provided.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion from the state the courts 1, 2 & 3 Dismissed, But Read In. 
AS TO COUNT 4  AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Cas passed to 1:30 PM for Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 4
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to REMOVE the Repeater enhancer, 939.62(1)(a).

Defendant Aisha Jackson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Aisha Jackson in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial.  Amended Information previously filed.  Copy previously given to defense counsel. Defendant waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Recieved & Filed State's Motion In Limine.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List.
Received & Filed, State's Response to Defendant's Memorandum in Support of Right to Assert Reasonable Discipline Defense.
Received & Filed, State's Memorandum In Support of Use of Certain Aspects of Defendant's Criminal History as Other Acts and Impeachment Evidence.

Attorney Adam c Essling in court, defendant Aisha Jackson not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Final Pretrial held. Received & Filed, Amended Information. Copy provided to defense. Court did NOT hold arraignment in this matter. Amended Information added Count 4: Failure to Act To Prevent Bodily Harm To A Child, Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 948.03(4)(b), 939.62(1)(b), a Class H Felony.  Parties ready to proceed to trial. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 07/20/2015.
CORRECTION: 6/8/15 entry reflects corrected information.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions.
Received & Filed, Memorandum In Support of Defendant's Right to Assert Reasonable Discipline Defense.

Defendant Aisha Jackson NOT in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Final Pretrial date prior to the trial date. Final Pretrial set for 7/9/2015 at 1:30 PM.
Signed & Filed, Order that ATTY. Adam C. Essling be, and hereby is, substituted as attorney of record for the Defendant in the above entitled matters.
Received & Filed, Cover Letter & Stipulation for Substitution of Attorney and Proposed Order.

Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen in court, defendant Aisha Jackson not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aisha Jackson in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Defendant Aisha Jackson in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.H. (5/13/2002), UNLESS APPROVED BY CHILDREN'S COURT ORDER.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Aisha Jackson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Aisha Jackson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
